alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Gilmer; Ritchie; Wirt (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 5:21PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Calhoun, southern Ritchie, northwestern Gilmer and east central Wirt Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 520 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of North Bend State Park, or 11 miles north of Grantsville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grantsville, Newberne, Smithville, Big Springs, Brohard, Macfarlan, Burnt House and Munday. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
